page.title: 19Totternhoe Farms
page.content: There are seven farms around the village. They vary in size from very small to large. The largest one belongs to Mr. Linney.The farm-house is across the road from the school and has a thatched roof. The farm includes many fields which stretch from the village up towards Dunstable. Mr. Linney has been a farmer for many years. He grows all sorts of crops including wheat, barley and oil seed rape. This turns the country-side yellow in the early Summer. He also keeps some animals including cows and sheep. The latter sometimes stray through a stile and into the school grounds. He owns tractors and other farm machinery which can be seen out on the roads at times. He has several large barns and silos for storage.
